meanings.definition: To become or act like a fanatic.
meanings.sent1: She began to fanaticize about her favorite band, collecting all their albums and attending every concert.
meanings.sent2: He tends to fanaticize over his favorite sports team, never missing a game.
meanings.sent3: Her friends jokingly told her not to fanaticize too much about her new hobby.
meanings.sent4: His passion for gardening made him fanaticize about every plant in his backyard.
meanings.sent5: The young artist would fanaticize about becoming famous one day, painting day and night.

meanings.definition: To obsessively support or promote something.
meanings.sent1: The company's marketing team would fanaticize their latest product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She would fanaticize her favorite charity, raising funds and awareness for their cause.
meanings.sent3: He would fanaticize his love for coffee by trying every blend available in town.
meanings.sent4: The politician would fanaticize his policies, believing they were the best for the country.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would fanaticize her students' success, always encouraging them to do their best.
